title: Worth its Weight in Gold or Yet Another Resource — A Comparative Study of Wiktionary, OpenThesaurus and GermaNet

author: Christian M. Meyer, Ubiquitous Knowledge Processing Lab, Darmstadt University of Technology

segmentation: So my name is Christian, I am I'm from Downstate University and I will present some joint work with Irina Gurevich that we published recently in the lecture notes of computers.
Times.
Many NLP applications require large amounts of lexical semantic knowledge.
So for example, machine translation or semantic search or word census immigration and most of the time we use expert build resources such as word net.
I think you'll know that it's kind of popular to use.
That and.
Yeah, we we have studied them for quite a long time and we have a lot of understanding about it.
Unfortunately, the size of this resources are quite limited and they're quite hard to keep updated during the time.
Yeah, there's quite some high construction costs to do that.
An emerging type of resources is collaboratively.
Built by web community.
They are freely available and available also in many languages and they've proven to be competitive to expert build resources.
Unfortunately, our understanding is quite limited of these resources, so we don't know so much about the structure and the content of these resources and that turned us to.
To this work, so we were particularly interested in how these kind of resources are organized.
Which kind of knowledge is actually encoded and what the strengths and drawbacks of the collaboratively build resources actually are.
So what we did is comparative.
Study of three lexical semantic resources.
We focused on the German language in this work, and we've chosen Gamonet Wiktionary and open Tesoros.
I will introduce these resources now.
So dictionary is just like Wikipedia, but it's not for encyclopedic knowledge, but for linguistic knowledge.

It's used, for example in open office for the spelling correction.

And we used that as an upper bound.

Also, there is still room for improvement, which we aim to do in a future study.

So having created this uniform representation of the resources, so the graph structure, we first studied several graph para meters, conductivity degree distribution, stuff like that, and what we found is that it is sufficient to focus on the largest connected component.
